an7.34:4.3: ‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.34:4.5: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for samādhi; being easy to correct, and good friendship.
an7.34:4.6: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
an7.34:4.7: That is what that god said.
an7.34:4.8: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
an7.34:5.1: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an7.34:5.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an7.34:5.4: and keen respect for the training.
an7.34:6.1: One with good friends, easy to correct,
an7.34:6.4: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
